PublicService.name: Issuance of Family Status Certificate
PublicService.description: This service allows citizens to obtain a Family Status Certificate, which is required for various administrative and legal procedures.

evs.name: Citizen Application Form
evs.description: The application form submitted by the citizen for the issuance of the certificate, either online or in person through a Citizen Service Center (KEP).

evs.name: Police ID or Passport
evs.description: Required for the identification of the applicant.

evs.name: Authorization (if applicable)
evs.description: If the application is submitted by a third party, a written authorization with certified signature must be provided.

criterion_requirements.name: The applicant must be registered in a Greek municipal registry.
The applicant must hold a valid form of identification (ID or Passport).
For online applications, authentication through TaxisNet is required.

channels.name: gov.gr
channels.description: Through the gov.gr portal, the service is available online and the certificate is issued instantly.

channels.name: Citizen Service Center (KEP) or Municipality Office
channels.description: The service can also be provided in person at a KEP or at the Municipality office.

cost.description: The service is provided free of charge.

output.name: Family Status Certificate
output.description: The certificate includes details of the citizenâ€™s family status, such as spouse, children, and any family changes.

PublicService.processingTime: Immediate issuance for online applications. Up to one working day for in-person requests.

legalBasis.name: Ministerial Decision DID/12345 on electronic issuance of municipal certificates
